member.name: N:Xceed.Wpf.Controls
member.summary: The Xceed.Wpf.Controls namespace defines various controls and utilities that are used by Xceed DataGrid for WPF.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoSelectBehavior
member.summary: Value indicating how the content of an AutoSelectTextBox is selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoSelectBehavior.Never
member.summary: The content is never selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoSelectBehavior.OnFocus
member.summary: The context is selected when the AutoSelectTextBox received the focus.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateComponent
member.summary: Value representing a date component.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateComponent.Year
member.summary: A year date component.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateComponent.Month
member.summary: A month date component.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateComponent.Day
member.summary: A day date component.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeMaskMode
member.summary: Value indicating the mode used to mask inputted text as a date and time format.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeMaskMode.Custom
member.summary: The CustomFormatSpecifier will be used.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeMaskMode.ShortDate
member.summary: The short date mask mode will be used.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeMaskMode.ShortDateAndShortTime
member.summary: The short date and time mask mode will be used.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeMaskMode.ShortDateAndLongTime
member.summary: The short date and long time mask mode will be used.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeMaskMode.ShortTime
member.summary: The short time mask mode will be used.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeMaskMode.LongTime
member.summary: The long time mask mode will be used.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.InsertKeyMode
member.summary: Value representing the text insertion mode of the masked text box.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.InsertKeyMode.Default
member.summary: The current INSERT key mode of the keyboard will be used.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.InsertKeyMode.Insert
member.summary: The insertion mode is always enabled.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.InsertKeyMode.Overwrite
member.summary: The overwrite mode is always enabled.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskFormat
member.summary: Value representing the format that will be used when the inputted text is copied to the clipboard.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskFormat.ExcludePromptAndLiterals
member.summary: Prompt characters and literals will be excluded.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskFormat.IncludeLiterals
member.summary: Only literals will be included.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskFormat.IncludePrompt
member.summary: Only prompt characters will be included.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskFormat.IncludePromptAndLiterals
member.summary: Both prompt characters and literals will be included.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information on inputted text whose mask is being automatically completed.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.MaskedTextProvider,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs class specifying the inputted text as well as the information required to automatically complete the mask.
member.param: A copy of the MaskTextProvider that was used to mask the inputted text.
A zero-based value indicating the position at which the automatic completion of the mask starts.
A value indicating the number of selected characters.
The inputted text.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs.AutoCompleteStartPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the position at which the automatic completion of the mask starts.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs.AutoCompleteText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that will be used to automatically complete the mask.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs.Input
member.summary: Gets the inputted text.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs.MaskedTextProvider
member.summary: Gets a copy of the MaskTextProvider that was used to mask the inputted text.
member.remarks: Any modifications made to this instance will not be reflected on the control.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs.SelectionLength
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the number of selected characters.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs.StartPosition
member.summary: Gets the position at which the inputted text starts.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoSelectTextBox
member.summary: Represents a text box whose content is selected when it receives the focus as well as performs automatic focus navigation when the caret reaches the extremities of the text range. " -->" -->

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AutoSelectTextBox class.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoSelectTextBox.AutoMoveFocus
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the focus can navigate in the appropriate flow direction (e.g., from one cell to another when a cell is being edited) when the cursor is at the beginning or end of the auto-select text box.

member.summary: Gets or sets the template used to display the content of the CalendarItem.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the CalendarItem contains content.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.CalendarItem.IsPreview
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the CalendarItem represents a preview day.
member.remarks: A preview day is a day that appears on the currently displayed month but that belongs either to the previous or next months.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.CalendarItem.IsToday
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the CalendarItem represents the present date ("Today").

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.CheckBox
member.summary: Represents a control used to edit and display boolean values. This class should be used rather than the system provided CheckBox control which causes issues with focus when used within a focus scope (e.g., DataGridControl).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DatePicker class.

member.summary: Invoked when an unhandled GotFocus attached event reaches this element in its route.
member.param: A RoutedEventArgs that contains the event data.

member.summary: Called when an unhandled PreviewGotKeyboardFocus event reaches this element.
member.param: A KeyboardFocusChangedEventArgs that contains the event data.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.CalendarItemContainerStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style to apply to the CalendarItem container.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.CalendarItemContainerStyleSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets a StyleSelector which provides custom style-selection logic for a style that can be applied to each generated container element.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.CalendarItems
member.summary: Gets the CalendarItems contained in the DatePicker's calendar.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.CalendarItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets or set the DataTemplate used to display each CalendarItem.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.CalendarItemTemplateSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets a DataTemplateSelector which provides custom logic for choosing a template used to display each CalendarItem.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.CustomFormatSpecifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom format specifier that will be used to mask the inputted text.
member.remarks: The custom format specifier will only be used if the DateTimeMaskMode property is set to DateTimeMaskMode.Custom.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.DateTimeMaskMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the date and time mask to apply to the inputted text.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.DayNames
member.summary: Gets or sets a one-dimensional string array containing the culture-specific full names of the days of the week, starting with the first day of the week defined by the current culture.
member.remarks: This property has no internal storage (100 re-generated when consulted) and will not receive change notifications.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayedMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the month currently displayed in the DatePicker's calendar.
member.remarks: Changing this property will cause the CalendarItems collection to update with the values of the new month. If the SyncCalendarWithSelectedDate property is set to true, changes made to the SelectedDate will also be applied to the DisplayedMonth/DisplayedYear properties.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayedMonthName
member.summary: Gets the name of the month currently displayed in the DatePicker's calendar.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.DisplayedYear
member.summary: Gets or sets the year currently displayed in the DatePicker's calendar.
member.remarks: Changing this property will cause the CalendarItems collection to update with the values of the new month/year. If the SyncCalendarWithSelectedDate property is set to true, changes made to the SelectedDate will also be applied to the DisplayedMonth/DisplayedYear properties.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.FormatProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the IFormatProvider that will be used to perform type validation.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.HasParsingError
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an error occurred during the parsing of the value.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.IsSelectedDateToday
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if SelectedDate corresponds to the current date ("Today").
member.remarks: This property has no internal storage (100 re-generated when consulted) and will not receive change notifications.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.SelectedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected date.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.ShortestDayNames
member.summary: Gets or sets a one-dimensional string array containing the culture-specific shortest unique abbreviated names of the days of the week, starting with the first day of the week defined by the current culture.
member.remarks: This property has no internal storage (100 re-generated when consulted) and will not receive change notifications.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.SyncCalendarWithSelectedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the date displayed in the DatePicker's calendar and the SelectedDate displayed in the DatePicker's text box should always be synchronized.
member.remarks: If the SyncCalendarWithSelectedDate property is set to true, changes made to the SelectedDate will also be applied to the DisplayedMonth/DisplayedYear properties.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePicker.TodayContent
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the "Today" button.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands
member.summary: Provides a set of commands that can be used to change the selected and displayed dates in the DatePicker control.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.ChangeDisplayedMonth
member.summary: Represents the ChangeDisplayedMonth command, which requests that the currently displayed month be changed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.ChangeDisplayedYear
member.summary: Represents the ChangeDisplayedYear command, which requests that the currently displayed year be changed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.ChangeSelectedDay
member.summary: Represents the ChangeSelectedDay command, which requests that the selected day be changed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.ChangeSelectedMonth
member.summary: Represents the ChangeSelectedMonth command, which requests that the selected month be changed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.ChangeSelectedWeek
member.summary: Represents the ChangeWeek command, which requests that the current week be changed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.ChangeSelectedYear
member.summary: Represents the ChangeSelectedYear command, which requests that the selected year be changed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.DisplayNextMonth
member.summary: Represents the DisplayNextMonth command, which requests that the next month be displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.DisplayNextYear
member.summary: Represents the DisplayNextYear command, which requests that the next year be displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.DisplayPreviousMonth
member.summary: Represents the DisplayPreviousMonth command, which requests that the previous month be displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.DisplayPreviousYear
member.summary: Represents the DisplayPreviousYear command, which requests that the previous year be displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.DisplayToday
member.summary: Represents the DisplayToday command, which requests that the present date ("Today") be displayed.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectNextDay
member.summary: Represents the SelectNextDay command, which requests that the next day be selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectNextMonth
member.summary: Represents the SelectNextMonth command, which requests that the same day in the next month be selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectNextWeek
member.summary: Represents the SelectNextWeek command, which requests that the same day in the next week be selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectNextYear
member.summary: Represents that SelectNextYear command, which requests that the same day in the next year be selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectPreviousDay
member.summary: Represents the SelectPreviousDay command, which requests that the previous day be selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectPreviousMonth
member.summary: Represents the SelectPreviousMonth command, which requests that the same day in the previous month be selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectPreviousWeek
member.summary: Represents the SelectPreviousWeek command, which requests that the same day in the previous week be selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectPreviousYear
member.summary: Represents the SelectPreviousYear command, which requests that the same day in the previous year be selected.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DatePickerCommands.SelectToday
member.summary: Represents the SelectToday command, which requests that the present date ("Today") be selected.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox
member.summary: Represents a control that limits the value extracted from the inputted text to be a DateTime value.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DateTimeTextBox class.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.GetFullFormatSpecifier(Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeMaskMode,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Retrieves the full format specifier for the specified DateTimeMaskMode and format provider.
member.param: A DateTimeMaskMode value representing the mode that was used to mask the inputted text.
The IFormatProvider that will be used to create the format specifier.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.OnAutoCompletingMask(Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the AutoCompletingMask event.
member.param: An AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs that contains the event data.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.OnInitialized(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the Initialized event.
member.param: An EventArgs that contains the event data.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.QueryValueFromTextCore(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Queries the specified text and returns its corresponding value converted to the type specified by the ValueDataType property and according to the format defined by the FormatSpecifier property.
member.returns: true if a value was extracted from the specified text; false otherwise.
member.param: A string representing the text to be converted.
The converted value. Can be $$NULL$$ if a value could not be extracted from text.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.CustomFormatSpecifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom format specifier that will be used to mask the inputted text.
member.remarks: The custom format specifier will only be used if the DateTimeMaskMode property is set to DateTimeMaskMode.Custom.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.DateTimeMaskMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the date and time mask to apply to the inputted text.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.CustomFormatSpecifierProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CustomFormatSpecifier dependency property.

member.name: F:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.DateTimeTextBox.DateTimeMaskModeProperty

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.Licenser
member.summary: Class that registers the classes defined in the Xceed.Wpf.Controls assembly.
member.remarks: It is recommended that the LicenseKey property be set in one of the following locations: Application.OnStartup method Preferred location Form.Loaded event The LicenseKey property can be set in this event as long as the startup form is known and invariable. Setting the LicenseKey property of the Licenser class defined in the Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid assembly will automatically license the classes in the Xceed.Wpf.Controls assembly.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.Licenser.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key used to license the classes contained in the Xceed.Wpf.Controls assembly.
member.remarks: It is recommended that the LicenseKey property be set in one of the following locations: Application.OnStartup method Preferred location Form.Loaded event The LicenseKey property can be set in this event as long as the startup form is known and invariable. Setting the LicenseKey property of the Licenser class defined in the Xceed.Wpf.DataGrid assembly will automatically license the classes in the Xceed.Wpf.Controls assembly.

member.name: T:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox
member.summary: Represents a control that limits the inputted text to be of the format determined by the specified mask.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MaskedTextBox class.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.CreateMaskedTextProvider(System.String,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the masked-text provider that will be used by the masked text box specifying various settings.
member.param: The string that will be used as the input mask.
The CultureInfo that will be used by the masked-text provider.
true if the prompt char should be considered as a valid input character; false, otherwise. By default, true.
A character that represents the positions in the masked text box that require input. By default, "_"­ (underscore).
A character that represents the character to used to mask a password.
true if non-ASCII characters are accepted; false otherwise. By default, false.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.GetFormatSpecifierFromMask(System.String,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Retrieves a format specifier from the specified mask and format provider.
member.param: The mask from which the format specifier is to be extracted.
An IFormatProvider that will be used to extract the appropriate symbols for any numeric mask characters contained in the mask.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.GetMaskCharacters
member.summary: Retrieves the mask characters that are supported by the masked text box.
member.returns: An array of characters containing the mask characters that are supported by the masked text box (see Remarks).
member.remarks: The following table provides a list of the supported mask characters: Mask character Description Importance 0 Digit. Any single digit between 0 and 9 inclusively. Required 9 Digit or space. Optional # Digit or space. If this position is blank in the mask, it will be rendered as a space. Plus (+) and minus (-) signs are allowed. L Letter. Restricts input to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. Required ? Letter. Restricts input to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z Optional & Character. If the RestrictToAscii property is set to true, this character will behave like the "L" character. Required C Character. Any non-control character. If the RestrictToAscii property is set to true, this character will behave like the "?" character. Optional A Alphanumeric. If the RestrictToAscii property is set to true, input will be restricted to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. Optional a Alphanumeric. If the RestrictToAscii property is set to true, input will be restricted to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. Optional . Decimal placeholder. The actual character will be the decimal symbol appropriate to the format provider. N/A , Thousands placeholder. The actual character will be the thousands symbol appropriate to the format provider. N/A : Time separator. The actual character will be the time separator appropriate to the format provider. N/A / Date separator. The actual character will be the date separator appropriate to the format provider. N/A $ Currency symbol. The actual character will be the currency symbol appropriate to the format provider. N/A < Shift down. Converts all following characters to lower case. N/A > Shift up. Converts all following characters to upper case. N/A | Disable a previous shift up or down. N/A \ Escape. Converts a mask character into a literal. N/A All others Literals N/A

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.OnAutoCompletingMask(Xceed.Wpf.Controls.AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the AutoCompletingMask event.
member.param: An AutoCompletingMaskEventArgs that contains the event data.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.QueryValueFromTextCore(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Queries the specified text and returns its corresponding value converted to the type specified by the ValueDataType property and according to the format defined by the FormatSpecifier property.
member.returns: true if a value was extracted from the specified text; false otherwise.
member.param: A string representing the text to be converted.
The converted value. Can be $$NULL$$ if a value could not be extracted from text.

member.name: M:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.ValidateValue(System.Object)
member.summary: Validates the specified value to ensure that it fits in the mask specified by the Mask property.
member.param: The value to validated.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.AllowPromptAsInput
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the prompt character should be considered as a valid input character.
member.remarks: ResetOnPrompt takes precedence over the AllowPromptAsInput property: ResetOnPrompt value AllowPromptAsInput value Behavior true true The prompt character can be entered and it causes the current mask position to be reset. true false The prompt character can be entered and it causes the current mask position to be reset. false true The prompt character is processed as a standard input character. false false The prompt character is not a valid input character.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.ClipboardMaskFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value representing the mask format that will be used when the inputted text is copied to the clipboard.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.HidePromptOnLeave
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the prompt character is hidden when the masked text box loses focus.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.IncludeLiteralsInValue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the literal characters in the input mask should be included in the formatted value.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.InsertKeyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value representing the text insertion mode of the masked text box.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.IsMaskCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if all required characters have been inputted into the mask.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.IsMaskFull
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if all characters, required and optional, have been inputted into the mask.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input mask.
member.remarks: The following table provides a list of the supported mask characters: Mask character Description Importance 0 Digit. Any single digit between 0 and 9 inclusively. Required 9 Digit or space. Optional # Digit or space. If this position is blank in the mask, it will be rendered as a space. Plus (+) and minus (-) signs are allowed. L Letter. Restricts input to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. Required ? Letter. Restricts input to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z Optional & Character. If the RestrictToAscii property is set to true, this character will behave like the "L" character. Required C Character. Any non-control character. If the RestrictToAscii property is set to true, this character will behave like the "?" character. Optional A Alphanumeric. If the RestrictToAscii property is set to true, input will be restricted to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. Optional a Alphanumeric. If the RestrictToAscii property is set to true, input will be restricted to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. Optional . Decimal placeholder. The actual character will be the decimal symbol appropriate to the format provider. N/A , Thousands placeholder. The actual character will be the thousands symbol appropriate to the format provider. N/A : Time separator. The actual character will be the time separator appropriate to the format provider. N/A / Date separator. The actual character will be the date separator appropriate to the format provider. N/A $ Currency symbol. The actual character will be the currency symbol appropriate to the format provider. N/A < Shift down. Converts all following characters to lower case. N/A > Shift up. Converts all following characters to upper case. N/A | Disable a previous shift up or down. N/A \ Escape. Converts a mask character into a literal. N/A All others Literals N/A

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.MaskedTextProvider
member.summary: Gets a copy of the MaskTextProvider that was used to mask the inputted text.
member.remarks: Any modifications made to this instance will not be reflected on the control.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.PromptChar
member.summary: Gets or sets the character that represents the positions in the masked text box that require user input.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.RejectInputOnFirstFailure
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if inputted text that is pasted into the masked text box can be rejected if it contains an invalid character for the corresponding mask position.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.ResetOnPrompt
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the character at the current caret position should be reset when the prompt character is pressed.
member.remarks: ResetOnPrompt takes precedence over the AllowPromptAsInput property: ResetOnPrompt value AllowPromptAsInput value Behavior true true The prompt character can be entered and it causes the current mask position to be reset. true false The prompt character can be entered and it causes the current mask position to be reset. false true The prompt character is processed as a standard input character. false false The prompt character is not a valid input character.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.ResetOnSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the character at the current caret position should be reset when the space bar is pressed.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.RestrictToAscii
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating ig the masked text box accepts non-ASCII characters.

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.MaskedTextBox.SkipLiterals
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if literal values can be overwritten by their same values

member.name: P:Xceed.Wpf.Controls.ValueRangeTextBox.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the control's value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the control's value.
member.remarks: If the ValueDataType property is not set, the inputted text will not be validated.
